tool.name: ProcessMultiNetTimeZones

param.name: input_ae_table
param.displayname: Input Administrative Area Extended Attributes (AE) Table
param.dialogReference: The table of your Tele Atlas MultiNet data that represents the administrative area extended attributes. This table has a name that typically ends in "AE".

param.name: input_admin_area_feature_classes
param.dialogReference:
The polygon feature classes of your Tele Atlas MultiNet data that represent the administrative areas. These feature classes has a name that typically ends in "A0", "A1", "A2", "A3", "A4", "A5", "A6", "A7", "A8", and "A9".

You only need to specify those feature classes that contain data for your area of interest. For example, in the United States, only the A0 (country), A1 (state), A8 (county), and A9 (minor civil division) feature classes contain data.

param.name: output_file_geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The full path including the name of the file geodatabase to be created containing the resulting time zone feature classes and tables.

param.name: input_ta_table
param.displayname: Input Transportation Element Belonging to Area (TA) Table
param.dialogReference: The table of your Tele Atlas MultiNet data that represents the transportation element belonging to area. This table has a name that typically ends in "TA". This parameter must be specified together with the Input Network Geometry (NW) Feature Class and Time Zone ID Base Field Name parameters.

param.name: input_nw_feature_class
param.dialogReference: The line feature class of your Tele Atlas MultiNet data that represents the network geometries. This feature class has a name that typically ends in "NW". This parameter must be specified together with the Input Transportation Element Belonging to Area (TA) Table and Time Zone ID Base Field Name parameters.

param.name: time_zone_id_base_field_name
param.displayname: Time Zone ID Base Field Name
param.dialogReference: Determines the name of the fields to be created in the output Streets feature class. The fields created in the Streets feature class will be named with "FT_" and "TF_" prefixed on the provided base field name.

tool.summary: This tool reads in Tele Atlas® MultiNet® data and creates a file geodatabase with a polygon feature class of the time zones. If the Network Geometry (NW) feature class is provided, then the output file geodatabase will also contain a Streets feature class and a TimeZones table for use in creating a network dataset with time zone information by using the ProcessMultiNetData tool.
tool.usage:
• Multiple regions of Tele Atlas MultiNet data can be processed together to create larger output feature classes. First use the Merge tool to combine the similar layers of the MultiNet data into common feature classes and tables, then pass these combined feature classes and tables as inputs to this tool.

  • This tool works best when run using an ArcInfo license. If you run the tool without an ArcInfo license, the time zone information in the output Streets feature class will be correct, but the time zone polygons will not be trimmed properly.

scriptExample.title: ProcessMultiNetTimeZones Python Example
scriptExample.para: Create time zone data from MultiNet data
scriptExample.code:
# Name: ProcessMultiNetTimeZones_nasample.py # Description: Create time zone data from MultiNet data. # Author: ESRI
#Import system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
#Import the toolbox containing the tool arcpy.ImportToolbox("C:/MyTools/Vendor Data Processing Tools.tbx")
#Set environment settings env.workspace = "C:/data/MultiNet"
#Set local variables inAE = "usaudc___________ae.dbf" inA0 = "usaudc___________a0.shp" inA1 = "usaudc___________a1.shp" inA8 = "usaudc___________a8.shp" inA9 = "usaudc___________a9.shp" outFileGDB = "DC.gdb" inTA = "usaudc___________ta.dbf" inNW = "usaudc___________nw.shp" baseFieldName = "TimeZoneID"
#Create the time zone data arcpy.ProcessMultiNetTimeZones_nasample(inAE, [inA0, inA1, inA8, inA9], outFileGDB, inTA, inNW, baseFieldName)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool reads in Tele Atlas® MultiNet® data and creates a file geodatabase with a polygon feature class of the time zones. If the Network Geometry (NW) feature class is provided, then the output file geodatabase will also contain a Streets feature class and a TimeZones table for use in creating a network dataset with time zone information by using the ProcessMultiNetData tool.
